quotes.quote: I like the night. Without the dark, we'd never see the stars.
I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.
The darker the night, the brighter the stars,  the deeper the grief, the closer is God!
It was the possibility of darkness that made the day seem so bright.
Night is a time of rigor, but also of mercy. There are truths which one can see only when it's dark
There was never a night or a problem that could defeat sunrise or hope.
Night time is really the best time to work. All the ideas are there to be yours because everyone else is asleep.
I often think that the night is more alive and more richly colored than the day.
Night is a world lit by itself.
Twilight drops her curtain down, and pins it with a star.
Night is the blotting paper for many sorrows.
Night hath a thousand eyes.
Night is the other half of life, and the better half.
The day is for honest men, the night for thieves.
Night is the mother of thoughts.
You can't stand up to the night until you understand what's hiding in its shadows.
The night is a skin pulled over the head of day that the day may be in torment.
Shadow owes its birth to light.
Night's deepest gloom is but a calm; that soothes the weary mind: The labored days restoring balm; the comfort of mankind.
Night brings our troubles to the light, rather than banishes them.
Shadows fall on even the brightest hours.
Night is a stealthy, evil Raven, Wrapt to the eyes in his black wings.
The man who has seen the rising moon break out of the clouds at midnight has been present like an archangel at the creation of light and of the world
After winter comes the summer. After night comes the dawn. After every storm, there comes clear, open skies.
In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men.
Night's black Mantle covers all alike.
A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
Night has brought to those who sleep, only dreams they can not keep.
Night hovers all day in the boughs of the fir tree.
No sight is more provocative of awe than is the night sky.
